69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:45): Pave The Cowpaths really should be about paving the cowpaths when something is paved at all -- i.e. given a requirement, satisfy it by enshrining what authors do instead of inventing something new that they have to learn.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:46): or maybe it should be about adding features based on what authors do, rather than on what we think they do
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:47): basically, it's either "class="footer" is used, so we should enshrine it" or "class="footer" is used, so we should have <footer>"
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:47): <footer> is the safer alternative, given the recent debate about predefined classes
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (21:49): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: I'm certainly happy to clarify it (and I owe a rewrite of Support Existing Content), but DanC asked me not to talk about it
